pullRequest.body:
This file is based on Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.Gradient.Basic, and describes the calculation properties

Co-authored-by: Ziyu Wang [tropicalfish910@gmail.com](mailto:tropicalfish910@gmail.com)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Since we already have `gradient` in mathlib, these theorems would be part of the accompanying API, so thanks for writing this file! I left a few comments requiring mostly minor changes, and I have the following suggestions:
1. Please add doc string headers for other sections like you did for finite sums / negative / difference.
2. I think it's better to call this file `Lemmas.lean`, following other parts of mathlib.
3. Pull request titles have the form "feat(OptionalRelevantFileOrDirectory): description of the content of your changes". There are also variants like "chore: rename some things" or "refactor: split some file into two". There used to be a community page describing this but I can't find it again.

I probably missed some minor points here and there, but I'll come back to review it again once these changes have been implemented.

> Since we already have `gradient` in mathlib, these theorems would be part of the accompanying API, so thanks for writing this file! I left a few comments requiring mostly minor changes, and I have the following suggestions:
> 
> 1. Please add doc string headers for other sections like you did for finite sums / negative / difference.
> 2. I think it's better to call this file `Lemmas.lean`, following other parts of mathlib.
> 3. Pull request titles have the form "feat(OptionalRelevantFileOrDirectory): description of the content of your changes". There are also variants like "chore: rename some things" or "refactor: split some file into two". There used to be a community page describing this but I can't find it again.
> 
> I probably missed some minor points here and there, but I'll come back to review it again once these changes have been implemented.

Thank you for your advice, I will fix this problems these days.

Looks nice, thanks!

The porting tool added newlines everywhere, but it's fine to have blocks of variable lines.

LGTM, but I would like to have another set of eyes on this.

Looks nice, thanks!

Dot notation is causing Lean to complain about structural recursion, probably because Lean thinks you're using `HasGradientWithinAt.const_smul` to prove itself. Writing the `HasGradientAtFilter` namespace out gets rid of this error and the need for the `nonrec` attribute here.
```suggestion
theorem HasGradientWithinAt.const_smul (h : HasGradientWithinAt f f' s x) (c : ð•œ) :
    HasGradientWithinAt (fun x => c â€¢ f x) ((starRingEnd ð•œ) c â€¢ f') s x := by
  exact HasGradientAtFilter.const_smul h c
```
Please make the same edit in all following instances. The use of dot notation is not essential, and it shouldn't come at the expense of having a confusing attribute that is not mathematically relevant.
Please address other instances of this.

I believe the naming convention is lower_snake_case here.
```suggestion
theorem gradient_const_smul (h : DifferentiableAt ð•œ f x) (c : ð•œ) :
```
Please change all following instances, too.
Please address other instances of this.

```suggestion
/-! ### Gradient of a finite sum of functions -/
```

```suggestion
/-! ### Gradient of the difference of two functions -/
```

Golfing a bit
```suggestion
  rw [HasGradientAtFilter, map_smulâ‚›â‚—]
```

The preferred style is to write each tactic on a separate line, instead of using `;` on the same line. That's superfluous anyway because that line is not used.
```suggestion
  rw [HasGradientAtFilter, map_smulâ‚›â‚—, RingHomCompTriple.comp_apply, RingHom.id_apply]
  exact HasFDerivAtFilter.const_smul h c
```

Golfed some more. Please find all remaining `;`'s and put them on new lines.
```suggestion
  rw [HasGradientAtFilter, map_add]
  exact HasFDerivAtFilter.add hf hg
```

```suggestion
  rw [HasGradientAtFilter, map_sum]
  exact HasFDerivAtFilter.sum h
```

```suggestion
  rw [HasGradientAtFilter, map_neg]
  exact HasFDerivAtFilter.neg h
```

```suggestion
variable {ð•œ F : Type*} [IsROrC ð•œ]
variable [NormedAddCommGroup F] [InnerProductSpace ð•œ F] [CompleteSpace F]
variable {f : F â†’ ð•œ} {f' x : F} {L : Filter F} {s : Set F}
```
Could you make this a simp lemma?

```suggestion
theorem gradient_const_add (c : ð•œ) : âˆ‡ (fun y => c + f y) x = âˆ‡ f x := by
```
simp lemma also.

```suggestion
/-! ### Gradient of a finite sum of functions -/
```
please make this a simp lemma.

```suggestion
    HasGradientWithinAt (fun x => c â€¢ f x) ((starRingEnd ð•œ) c â€¢ f') s x :=
  HasGradientAtFilter.const_smul h c
```
`by exact` is redundant most of the time. Same thing several times below.

```suggestion
  rw [this]
  exact hf.add hg
```
Just one tactic per line, unless there is a good reason.

```suggestion
theorem gradient_sub_const (c : ð•œ) : âˆ‡ (fun y => f y - c) x = âˆ‡ f x := by
```
simp lemma.
simp lemma

```suggestion
    âˆ‡ (fun y => c - f y) x = âˆ‡ (fun y => - f y + c) x := by congr with x; rw [sub_eq_neg_add]
```
this lemma name is bad, as it is way too generic compared to the statement. `smul_toDual_add_smul_toDual_eq_toDual` would be better, for instance.

In the rest of this section, `F` has both the structure of a real inner product space and of a `ð•œ`-inner product space, which is rather bad. Could you use another space for the space with the real inner product structure, for instance `E`, to avoid the confusion?

```suggestion
variable {c' a' : F} {c a : F â†’ ð•œ} {x : F} (d b : ð•œ)
```

again, the lemma name is not good. But I would probably just remove it: it seems to me that all the lemmas in this section can be deduced from the lemmas of the previous one, together with the fact that a constant function has zero gradient, no? This would probably be more direct.

pullRequest.title: feat: arithmetic lemmas for `gradient`
